Name: BfsMedstats17Admitsource

Im Rahmen des Spitalaufenthaltes belegte Liegeklasse, nicht die Versicherungskategorie. Bei Wechsel der Klasse ist die im Wesentlichen beanspruchte Klasse anzugeben.

Name: BfsMedstats25Mainguarantor
Title: BFS Medizinische Statistik - 25 1.4.V02 - Hauptkostenträger für Grundversicherungsleistungen / Prise en charge des soins de base / Unità d’imputazione principale per le prestazioni dell’assicurazione di base
Descriptino: BFS defines variables for medical statistic (german, french, italian) see [BFS](https://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/de/home/statistiken/kataloge-datenbanken/publikationen.assetdetail.7066232.html). Angabe des Hauptgaranten, der für die Kosten der Grundversicherungsleistungen des Spitalaufenthalts im Wesentlichen aufkommt. Keine Mehrfachnennungen möglich.

Descriptino: BFS defines variables for medical statistic (german, french, italian) see [BFS](https://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/de/home/statistiken/kataloge-datenbanken/publikationen.assetdetail.7066232.html). Wohin wurde der Patient entlassen?

Name: BfsMedstats29Dischargeencounter
Title: BFS Medizinische Statistik - 29 1.5.V04 - Behandlung nach Austritt / Prise en charge après la sortie / Trattamento dopo l’uscita
Descriptino: BFS defines variables for medical statistic (german, french, italian) see [BFS](https://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/de/home/statistiken/kataloge-datenbanken/publikationen.assetdetail.7066232.html). Behandlung, Pflege, Rehabilitation nach dem Spitalaufenthalt. Es geht darum, den Behandlungserfolg resp. den Abhängigkeitsgrad bei Austritt anzugeben. Nur die am besten zutreffende Kategorie auswählen.

In the Swiss healthcare system, an additional value is used that is not covered by the BFS variables, so the code for supplementary insurance is defined here.

Name: DocumentRelationshipType
Title: DocumentRelationshipType
Descriptino: The type of relationship between documents.

Name: IHE_FormatCode_codesystem
Title: IHE Format Code set for use with Document Sharing
Descriptino: The [IHE](http://www.ihe.net) FormatCode code system with canonical URI of http://ihe.net/fhir/ihe.formatcode.fhir/CodeSystem/formatcode is defined to be the set of FormatCodes define by IHE, for use with [Document Sharing](https://profiles.ihe.net/ITI/HIE-Whitepaper/index.html). This code set additionally includes, as deprecated, format codes defined by [HL7 for some Implementation Guides](http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=CDA_Format_Codes_for_IHE_XDS). The HL7 codes are now managed by HL7. The set of IHE FormatCode codes was listed in HITSP C80 Table 2-153 Format Code Value Set Definition, but since has been updated. The use of the FormatCode specifies the technical format of the document. The FormatCode tends to reference the IHE Content Profile (Implementation Guide) that defines the use-case and constraints. The FormatCode is a further specialization more detailed than the mime-type. The FormatCode provides sufficient metadata information to allow any potential document content consumer to know if it can process and/or display by identifying a document encoding, structure and template. The set of codes is intended to be preferred.

Name: SNOMED_CT
Title: SNOMED CT (all versions)
Descriptino: SNOMED CT is the most comprehensive and precise clinical health terminology product in the world, owned and distributed around the world by The International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO).

Name: ConditionCategoryCodes
Title: Condition Category Codes
Descriptino: Preferred value set for Condition Categories.

Name: ParticipationFunction
Title: ParticipationFunction
Descriptino: This code is used to specify the exact function an actor had in a service in all necessary detail. This domain may include local extensions (CWE).

Name: SubstanceAdminSubstitution
Title: Substance Admin Substitution
Descriptino: Identifies what sort of change is permitted or has occurred between the therapy that was ordered and the therapy that was/will be provided.

Name: UCUM
Title: Unified Code for Units of Measure (UCUM)
Descriptino: The Unified Code for Units of Measure (UCUM) is a code system intended to include all units of measures being contemporarily used in international science, engineering, and business. The purpose is to facilitate unambiguous electronic communication of quantities together with their units. The focus is on electronic communication, as opposed to communication between humans. A typical application of The Unified Code for Units of Measure are electronic data interchange (EDI) protocols, but there is nothing that prevents it from being used in other types of machine communication.

Name: Ietf3066
Title: Tags for the Identification of Languages
Descriptino: Older value from OID registry.  Superceded; see recommendations in BCP-47.

Name: EdqmStandardTerms
Title: EDQM - Standard Terms
Descriptino: EDQM - Standard Terms used in Switzerland (aggregations of codes of ValueSets Route of Administration, Dose Form and Administration Method, see original codes system defined in https://standardterms.edqm.eu/#)

Name: ChEhealthCodesystemFormat
Title: ch-ehealth-codesystem-format
Descriptino: Document format as per Annex; EPRO-FDHA.         This unambiguous code defines the format of the XDS document. Together with the mimetype, this should provide the potential consumer with sufficient information as to whether they are in a position to process the document.

Name: ChEhealthCodesystemLanguage
Title: ch-ehealth-codesystem-language
Descriptino: Document language as per Annex 3 EPRO-FDHA. Defines the language in which the document was written.
